decision_conditions: This permission shall be for a limited period only expiring on 17th March 2023 on or before which date the use hereby permitted shall be discontinued and no seating and barriers shall be placed outside.
To enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control.
At all times during operation of the use, a removable means of enclosure shall be used to demarcate the seating area
Reason: In the interest of highway safety.

The siting of the external drinking area hereby approved shall take place only within the area directly adjacent to the front elevation of 33-37 Corbets Tey Road and extending no more than 2m in depth from this elevation, as indicated on the approved plan. No furniture or other articles related to the approved use, including the means of enclosure, shall be sited within 1.5m of the side access road kerbline.
Reason: In order to contain the potential obstruction of the pavements/service road, in the interest of pedestrian and highway safety.
The outdoor seating area shall only be used between 11.00 and 23.00. Outside these times, no tables and chairs shall be placed outside the premises.

To enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control in the interests of public safety and in order that the development accords with Development Control Policies Development Plan Document Policy DC61
There shall be no loudspeakers, for the reproduction of music or otherwise, provided in the vicinity of the external drinking area.
Reason: To prevent noise nuisance to adjoining and neighbouring properties in the interest of residential amenity.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraphs 186-187 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2012.

1.  The applicant is advised that this permission relates only to the approval given by the Council as Local Planning Authority. Separate consent from the Council under the provisions of the Highways Act 1980 (as amended) should be obtained before this planning permission can be implemented.

2. The applicant is reminded that they need to operate their premises in accordance with the four licensing objectives. A crime and disorder profile for the location and the surrounding area will form part of any assessment should a further application be submitted within the next 3 years for the use to be permanently retained.
description: To permit continued use of the pavement cafe area currently authorised under Planning Permission P0350.17
